text: and initiatives that support the councilâ€™s vision to become a carbon neutral borough, improving air quality and reducing waste (including promoting the circular economy). 11.64 It is acknowledged that existing planning obligations would sit in some of the themes above and therefore already provide some social value benefits to the local community. However, the content of the social value strategy should be independent of these, and target areas that the planning obligations do not address, to provide additionality and to complement any existing obligations. The strategy should be project specific, allowing flexibility for each development to develop a social BACK TO POLICIES value strategy that is informed by its site-specific local needs analysis and consultation. 11.65 Examples of potential social value contributions, that should be project specific: z spatial and environmental improvement works that improve health
